intro: Lepturus paniculatus, commonly known as the panicled lepturus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It produces small, dry fruits that contain one or two seeds. Lepturus paniculatus is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
